sourceDesc.p: Converted from a Word document written by mharty

list.item: convert those “,” things to just comma
for MH text files, insert corresponding MH citation

body.p: “Examined as well as I could with the glass what I will call the tweezer bird- / Tra-wee, shreea-shre / -raspingly I have heard perhaps as long as the Evergreen forest. It is slende- somewhat small vireo like bird- yellow & yellowish all beneath- except a chesnutish (?) crescent on breast- with ap. a white spot on the wing- an certainly a yellow or greenish yellow back between wings. Keeping rather high in the trees- I could not see the general color of the upper-parts but thought it was dark olivaceous or maybe slaty. Can it be the blue-yellow-back warbler?
"XVII / 13 February-3 September 1854 / NNPM MA 1302:23 / PE 8, p.208 vol.8; Torrey JVI & JVII, p.#"
